Package tictactoe

Class SmartComputer

  • java.lang.Object
    • tictactoe.SmartComputer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComputerPlayer
    public class SmartComputer
extends java.lang.Object
implements ComputerPlayer
    A ComputerPlayer that tries to block the player and to make moves that are somewhat intelligent.

    A priority is calculated for each square on the game board, based on the number of game pieces in a row in each direction. The square that has the highest priority will be selected.

    Author:
    Tapio Malmberg

      • getMove

        public Coordinate getMove​(ImmutableGameBoard gameBoard,
                          int numInARowToWin)
        Returns a Coordinate with the highest calculated priority.
        Specified by:
        getMove in interface ComputerPlayer
        Parameters:
        gameBoard - the game board
        numInARowToWin - the number of pieces in a row needed to win
        Returns:
        a Coordinate with the highest calculated priority

      • getHighestPriorityMove

        private Coordinate getHighestPriorityMove()
        Returns the Coordinate of the square that has the highest priority.

        If there are many squares that have the highest priority, the first one will be selected.

        Returns:
        the Coordinate of the square with the highest priority

      • addPrioritiesForBlockingMoves

        private void addPrioritiesForBlockingMoves()
        Calculates the priorities for moves that block the player.

      • addPrioritiesForPossibleMoves

        private void addPrioritiesForPossibleMoves()
        Calculates the priorities for moves that help the computer win.

      • calculatePriorities

        private void calculatePriorities​(Direction dir,
                                 byte player,
                                 int largeBoost,
                                 int smallBoost)
        Calculates a priority for each square based on the number of pieces in a row in the given direction for the given player.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction for counting the adjacent pieces
        player - the human player or the computer player
        largeBoost - the value added to the priority of a square that is one move away from victory
        smallBoost - the value added to the priority of a square that is two moves away from victory

      • increaseSquarePriority

        private void increaseSquarePriority​(int x,
                                    int y,
                                    int priority)
        Increases the priority of the square at the (x, y) coordinate by the given amount and keeps track of the current maximum priority.
        Parameters:
        x - the x value of the square on the game board
        y - the y value of the square on the game board
        priority - the amount the priority of the square will be increased.

      • isAvailable

        private boolean isAvailable​(int x,
                            int y)
        Tests whether a square on the game board is available.
        Parameters:
        x - the x value of the square on the game board
        y - the y value of the square on the game board
        Returns:
        true if the square at (x, y) is within the game board and it is empty

      • getMiddlePositionOrRandomMove

        private Coordinate getMiddlePositionOrRandomMove()
        Either returns the middle square of the game board, or if it is taken, a random square utilizing RandomComputer.
        Returns:
        the middle square or a random square
